channel.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

Docent:

If you’re looking to relive the memories of your childhood, I wouldn’t suggest using Project-Exile.

What would you suggest? I haven’t found any other server that will run properly. Well, now that my client is torched I’m at odds with the whole thing… but your guidance is appreciated.

-edit-

After reading around, and realizing how bad Project Exile is, I’ve decided to go with Asteria 2.0. I have no idea what I’m doing and I feel like I’m in over my head, but I’m determined and confident that my server will be great in due time. ^^

Read full topic

item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:10, topic:543526”]Search for the empty stalls id then check the spawn code.

As for the door, send the remove item packet to its position. You can find such info on the wiki.[/quote]

Thank you sir!

Got it working with the outstanding assistance of IfearI.

Still can’t get the forge door out, but I’ve run into bigger problems. I can’t run my client anymore.

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

Thanks for the reply!

I will see if that works for the PkP Shop and let you know how it goes.

So, basically I can just delete the donor shop altogether, and add the items to NPC drops in the drop tables? I think I will have to remove the donor requirement on the items as well, which I think I know how to do.

I believe I set it up correctly, because I didn’t get any errors aside from the warnings in Eclipse. I just find that searching in the root Server folder is simply than trying to sift through all the stuff on Eclipse, unless there’s a similar search feature in Eclipse that i’m unaware of, I’m fine doing it this way for now… haha.

Thanks again for your reply.

I’m also trying to deal with this:

I CANNOT remove this forge door. Any ideas?

Also, I managed to get these thieving stalls in here and facing the right direction, but when I steal from the Topaz stall, it changes direction. I know it has something to do with the positioning of the Empty stall during the ‘cooldown’ period, but I don’t know where to find that.

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

[quote=“Murk3d09, post:1, topic:543526”]1. I want to make it to where Pvp Artifacts are sold for gold instead of PK points. I want to completely remove the PK point shop and make the items acquirable in other ways.

Now the code for turing in artifacts is;

if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(14876,1)) { //if the item is the artifact (id = 14876) c.getItems().deleteItem(14876,1); //delete the artifact c.getVariables().pkp += 15; //give pk points

How would I change this to give gold instead?[/quote]

Basically you would delete the last line giving the pk points and replace it with a line giving items. I’m assuming such methode would be in c.getItems() as well… Probabaly something like c.getItems().addItem(id, amount).

Murk3d09:

2. I also want to remove the Donator Shop completely and add those items to the drop tables, but I’ll get to that later. If you’ve got any information or an indication as to what files I would edit for that I’d appreciate it. I don’t want stuff to be handed to me with no effort, just some help from fellow coders is welcomed and I am grateful.

Shops and drop tables are usually stored in seperate files in a data folder.

Murk3d09:

3. Character files aren’t saving to the Eclipse project, but they are saving to the original server folder. Also, some files in the original server folder are not present in the Project, for instance Dialoguehandler.java. I cannot find it in Eclipse, but it is easily found in the server files.

I’m assuming you didn’t set up your eclipse project correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

Pure_:

If you want something good you’ll need to either splash the bank or learn to program, start with javadocs.

I’m not familiar with the term ‘splash the bank’, but I’m assuming it has something to do with purchasing something? lol.

We plan to eventually learn how to code so we can do things ourselves, but we need a foundation.

I’ve not managed to get ANY decent sources working. Downloads are outdated, some have missing files, and some have anti-leech that I can’t figure out how to fix to even get into the server to begin learning. I’m becoming demoralized.

-Updated original post-

Read full topic

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

Well it doesn’t need to be 562, we just don’t want anything in the 700s. I’d also prefer not to start with something too difficult, because I don’t want to get frustrated before I get in the groove of applying myself and learning through trial and error. I’m stuck because I feel like starting with a feature-rich server will present me fewer opportunities to make the server truly mine while at the same time I feel like starting with a blank server with my lack of coding knowledge will be biting off more than I can chew. haha. My brother and I will have to make a decision.

thank you for your reply.

Well… I’ve run into a problem. I’ve tried a few sources both blank and feature-rich and it seems that the RSPS Download section is too outdated. Most of the download links didn’t work, and the one’s that did work were just really bad servers that some 15 year old went ape shit on with adding every tutorial he could find. I’m kinda lost now.

Read full topic

item.source: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

Well first, which version are you looking for?

As for the rest of the problems, that is just a matter of changing some numbers. Rock crabs have a special death animation, and when the server doesn’t know which one it is they just send a generic one, usually fit for humanoids. The same goes for the woodcutting animation. Trees/Ores disappearing would require a way to keep track of object states and update all clients of the changes. It isn’t very hard but most servers don’t have a nice system in place for it.

Developing and managing a server take quite a bit of time, but if you guys were able to wait a few years for better equipment you should have no problem with the time investment. The most important thing to remember is that your player base will be a little more understanding of problems if you can show them you are dedicated to the well-being of the server and not your wallets.

Thank you for a quick response!

We are interested in using a 562 version. Although we would really like to have our server set up like the current BattleScape which includes a feature that allows changing the graphics version in the client, we aren’t ready for that yet, I don’t think. So yea, 562 is what we are looking at.

Thanks for the information on those minor bugs, also!

I agree with you there, we did wait a long time to put this plan in motion, so I hope once we gain some players they recognize our commitment to the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance

item.title: Hi! New to this... seeking guidance
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Murk3d09, post:1, topic:543526”]Inquiries:

[ol][li]What is a good source/client combo to use for beginners? Would you recommend using a server with tons of content already, or would you recommend using a blank server and adding things on our own?[/li]
[li]Many servers we’ve played have had NPC models that were glitchy. For instance a Rock Crab’s death/attack animation were stretchy and glitched. How do we prevent this from happening in our server?[/li]
[li]What are some tutorials/threads we should read to make this process more educational and easier on us as time goes on?[/li]
[li]In your opinion, what is the difficulty of fixing simple bugs like a Steel Hatchet always being displayed when you chop wood regardless of your equipped hatchet? Or Trees and Ores not disappearing when being harvested?[/li]
[li]How difficult do you think it will be for us to transition into Private Server Owner statuses? meaning simply how hard is it to build a server and manage it as a beginner? We’re just trying to gauge the level of commitment and understand what’s expected of us as up and coming server developers.[/li][/ol][/quote]
Well first, which version are you looking for?

As for the rest of the problems, that is just a matter of changing some numbers. Rock crabs have a special death animation, and when the server doesn’t know which one it is they just send a generic one, usually fit for humanoids. The same goes for the woodcutting animation. Trees/Ores disappearing would require a way to keep track of object states and update all clients of the changes. It isn’t very hard but most servers don’t have a nice system in place for it.

Developing and managing a server take quite a bit of time, but if you guys were able to wait a few years for better equipment you should have no problem with the time investment. The most important thing to remember is that your player base will be a little more understanding of problems if you can show them you are dedicated to the well-being of the server and not your wallets.

Read full topic
